modules.description: Calculates cosine and sine values for a given angle, converts between degrees and radians, and checks for NaN values. It handles floating-point numbers and 3D vectors to compute geometric properties like dihedral angles. Performs approximate equality checks and ensures non-zero distances for numerical stability.

Provides functions to construct quaternions from scalar values, convert between quaternions and string representations, and transform quaternions to and from axis-angle pairs. Operates on a quaternion type containing four floating-point components and a 3D vector type for axis representation. Used to serialize quaternion data for logging and to convert between rotation representations in 3D graphics applications.

Provides rotation operations including creation from angles, axes, quaternions, and decomposition into axis-angle representations. Works with float-based rotation matrices and 3D vectors. Used for transforming 3D points, converting between rotation formats, and serializing rotations as strings.

Computes specific angular parameters phi and psi, and generates quaternion-based rotations and samples for 3D orientation tasks. It handles quaternions and rotation structures, producing arrays of rotated values for simulation or animation purposes. The super_fibonacci function calculates weighted quaternion sequences based on input parameters.

This module offers comprehensive 3D vector manipulation, including arithmetic operations (addition, scaling), geometric computations (dot product, cross product, magnitude), and normalization, alongside distance calculations and data serialization. It works with a core 3D vector type, enabling conversions between vector, string, and triplet formats. Applications include physics simulations, computer graphics, and spatial analysis where precise vector transformations and measurements are required.

Handles molecular geometry operations, including atom position transformations and bond angle calculations. Works with custom data structures representing molecular coordinates and connectivity. Used to preprocess ligand conformations for docking simulations with fixed protein structures.

Computes trigonometric values, handles angle conversions, and performs geometric calculations using 3D vectors and quaternions. Supports quaternion construction, serialization, and rotation transformations, enabling 3D orientation and animation. Provides vector arithmetic, normalization, and distance computations for spatial applications. Generates angular parameters and quaternion sequences for simulations, with operations to convert between rotation representations and serialize data.
